data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In the instructions if we only face forward then we have 9 steps left. In this example we have 9 steps left, 10 steps forward and 9 steps right. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around and turn right, you will be going back to your starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you take 4 steps, you can turn around and take 10 steps. In the first instructions you take 6 steps, so you take 6 steps to get there. The first instruction takes 6 steps to get there, so you take 6 steps to get there. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 7 steps and are returning back to the beginning point, then you can resit. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You only have 10 steps to get back to the starting point. With one foot planted on the starting point, the number of steps required is 4 ( 10 + 3 + 9 + 3 + 6 + 9 + 20 + 20). So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning right is the opposite of turning left. Take 7 steps to the right and from there you are 7 steps back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Taking 8 steps and taking 9 steps would return you to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around: Take 8 steps. Return to starting point: Take 6 steps. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Forward steps always occur in the same direction as the forward step. Correct direction is always the same. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The instructions are similar: Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
After the first step, you still have 3 steps forward in your direction. Then, when you have 1 step backward, you begin to take 3 steps forward in your direction. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you face forward, go 6 steps backwards, then go 8 steps right. In general, when you are facing forward/forward you, do the following: If you face forward, either take 6-7 steps back to the starting point or take 6-7 steps back to the starting point. Thus, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take 4 steps right. Take 4 steps left. Take one step left. Take 2 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left., Take 8 steps together., Take 6 steps together., Take 9 steps right. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When you facing forward, there is no need to take any step backward. When you make a change from walking forward, you immediately must take one step forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The first step is to always face forward. The second step refers to taking 6 steps left, and the second step is to take 3 steps each. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around, you get a full circle and turn around to return to the starting block. If you take 4 steps, and take 10 steps, you walk back 10 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Steps do not have to be turned around if you want to return to the starting point. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If one completes an 11a.m. turn around, one does not complete a 9 a.m. turn around. A 9 a.m. turns right when one completes the 11a.m. turn around. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 2 steps. Take 9 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take 4 steps to turn right. Take 5 steps to turn left. Take 6 steps to turn right. Take 4 steps to turn right. Take 2 steps to turn right. Take 3 steps to turn left. Turn right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right once for 1 step, then 6 steps for one and another step, then 4 steps for 7 and 3 steps for 5. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 1 step. Take 1 step. Take 3 steps. Turn left. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Each of the instructions requires you to step away from one thing to make a new step. To return to the starting point, you have to step again and take a new step. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 5 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you get back to the starting point, you can take 6 steps. If you take 3 steps, you take 6 steps. If you take 2 steps, you take 2 steps. If you do all of these, you return to the starting point in a total of 6 steps. There are 5 total steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you return to the starting point after taking 3 steps, you begin the process over in 3 steps. If you take 7 steps back and turn around, you complete the process of returning to the starting point in 7 steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you take 7 steps left, you go 1 Step forward. If you take 7 steps right, you go 2 Steps backward. If you take 2 steps right, you go 7 Step forward. If you take 7 steps right, you go 7 Step backward. If you do all of these in reverse, you cannot go back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 9 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you follow the instructions, you always face forward. If you face backward and then go backward 7 steps, you would come to the beginning point. If you always faced forward and take 9 steps left it would also come back to the beginning point. If you follow the instructions and return to the starting point 7 steps backward, you would return to the beginning point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If I turn around, my starting point will be at the point where I was turned around. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps left. Take 6 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person who always faces forward would take 6 steps left. If you were to reverse this, you would take 6 steps right. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Turn around. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You take 3 steps backward. This is the same in both directions. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 4 steps. Take 1 step. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 1 step back. You do not get back to the starting point if you take one step back in the same order. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around takes one around. Nine steps is enough for a full circle. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps right. Take 7 steps backward. Take 3 steps left. Take 8 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You should always go back in front of you to get to the starting point, always face forward. The step by step instructions were to always face forward. They made you always go in the direction of right. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Turn around. Turn around. Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

First you would take 6 steps while you are taking 7 steps away, like the first step. You would then do that 5 times, which would be 5 steps, and this would take you back to where you started. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To return to the starting point you would always face forward. So, the answer is No.

Let’ s say you have been told to always look forward. In order to turn back, you have to go left, then right. A total of 11 steps are required. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps forward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 7 steps left. Take 7 steps right. Take 8 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The last step to the right is to take 8 steps backward. The last step to the left is to take 7 steps right. The last step to the right is to take 4 steps forward. If you did the exercises in a sequence, every one of the sets went back to the start point. The numbers change for each sequence. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 8 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around has two steps followed by 8 steps. Take 10 steps and turn around and you are done. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps forward. Take 4 steps forward. Take 9 steps backward. Take 1 step backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, you take 4 steps forward, take 6 steps forward, take 4 steps forward, take 9 steps backward, take 1 step backward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 5 steps. Take 5 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The five steps taken on the fifth step means the same thing as the one taken on the fourth step. Each of the six alternative steps is five steps long. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 7 steps left. Take 4 steps backward. Take 8 steps backward. Take 3 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

As long as you remain facing forward, you move the point of starting. Take 6 steps toward the starting point. As long as you move the point of starting away., you move the point of starting towards the ending point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To move backward takes 2 steps, not 3. To move forward means 6 steps. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You turn around one step. When you turn right, you turn left. Once you turn right and turn right, then the route is reversed and you don’ t have to complete any of the steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 8 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Take 4 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Any time you go backward, you start from a starting point. To take reversed steps, you take 7 steps left, 8 steps right and 4 steps left. All of these directions are taken facing forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 4 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 5 steps left. Take 6 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The instructions are to always face forward. The sequence is to always have 5 steps right and take 4 steps backward. The sequence is to never face left and take 6 steps backward. The sequence is to never take 5 steps right and take 1 step forward and take 3 steps right. The sequence is to never take 5 steps right and take 4 steps backward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 4 steps right. Take 4 steps left. Take 8 steps left. Take 2 steps forward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 3 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first step of the instructions refers to the first step in the correct direction. The second step is the first step in the correct direction. The third step should always be taken right of the first step. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn left and you are walking down the street. Take 3 steps and turn right. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps right. Take 9 steps left. Take 5 steps left. Take 8 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
There are always steps left and there are always steps right. If you go in the wrong direction you will never be able to go back the way in which you came. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 5 steps backward. Take 2 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you followed the above instructions, you would always be facing forward. Generally, backwards and forwards are opposite directions, to the point of needing to bend your knee. If you are facing forward, you would bend your knees every time you walked in that direction. To face forward, you take 5 steps left of the starting point. 5 steps backward is the opposite of face forward. On the other hand, 1 step forward is the opposite of always facing forward. Therefore, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps backward. Take 8 steps backward. Take 10 steps forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 1 step forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 1 step left. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you face forward, you are always facing forward. If you are facing backward, you are facing backward. If you are facing forward, you are always facing forward. If you are facing left and right, you are always facing right and left. Take 4 steps backward, take 2 steps forward and 2 steps right. Take 1 step behind and take 2 steps left. If you are facing left and right, you are always facing right and right. If you are facing forward and you are taking 10 steps forward and 2 steps left. If you are face first, you are always facing left and right. If you are facing right, you are always facing right and right. If you are facing left and you are taking 7 steps backward and 2 steps right, you are always facing right and right. If you are facing left and you are taking 7 steps backward, you are always facing right and right. If you are facing left and you are taking 10 steps forward and 2 steps right, you are always facing the starting point. If you are facing away from yourself and you are looking at the starting point, you are always facing the beginning point. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 10 steps right. Take 4 steps forward. Take 1 step left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

In these instructions you always face forward. If you took 7 steps backward you would be facing 0 degrees. If you took 10 steps right you would be facing + 10 degrees. If you took 4 steps forward you would be facing + 4 degrees. If you took 1 step left you would be facing -. If you took 0 degrees you would be facing the starting point. Thus, the answer is No.
